Author: Throwaway74882919927
Text: Okay, thank you! Have I already put myself at risk by binging on glucose and eating more than 50% of my tdee? That's what I'm scared about :/ (I did this before I knew what refeeding syndrome was)

Author: altoristics
Text: The most important thing is to tell someone, so that they can check in on you (collapsing and no one realising would be the easiest way to die). The best thing would be a medical professional to monitor you but if you’re really against that/can’t, From looooking it up, it says make sure to get electrolytes and minerals (thiamine is really important), don’t eat a lot of glucose (e.g carbs), and don’t eat more than 50% of your energy requirements (e.g 50% of your TDEE).  Again the most important thing is having someone else who knows where you are and can call/come in person to check in on you.
